@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.array.u.name: unique
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.array.u.description: This function will return a filtered array without any duplicated

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.name: querySelectorLive
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.description:
Observe the dom to get all the elements that matches a passed css selector at any point in time.
Be warned that this use the mutation observer API and will monitor all the document for new nodes. Make sure to use it
when you don't have the chance to use the custom elements API instead

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Global reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Destyle reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Sugar reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Typography
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

example.title: h1
example.code: Mr. Douglas Bartell

example.title: h2
example.code: Carolyn Schinner

example.title: h3
example.code: Alfred Yundt

example.title: h6

example.title: p

example.title: lead
example.code:
<lead class="s-typo:lead">
      Arturo Ziemann
  </lead>

example.title: hr
example.code:
<hr class="s-typo:hr">
      Ashley Sauer
  </hr>

example.code:

      Rosie Kuhn II
  </pre:not([class])>

example.title: code:not(pre > code)
example.code:
<code:not(pre > code) class="s-typo:code:not(pre > code)">
      Ray Jacobs
  </code:not(pre > code)>

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Fit Sizes
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

contain
none

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows to apply some text styling like `text-align: left`, `text-align: right`, `text-decoration: underline`, etc...
directly inside your HTML.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Disabled
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply the disabled style on any HTMLElement.
This make sure *no pointer events** stays active as well as displaying the **not-allowed cursor**.

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <input type="text" class="s-input s-disabled" placeholder="I'm disabled" />

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Offsize
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

Inline
Block
Inline end

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Scale
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: These classes allows you to apply some white-space style on any HTMLElement

example.title: Wrap

example.code: Est dolorum id quibusdam. Repellat cupiditate sit repellat ut nam temporibus unde perspiciatis. Et labore labore assumenda molestias et aut nisi. Eos est dolorem rem possimus. Deleniti sunt quam consequuntur.

example.title: Normal
example.code: Modi placeat nihil consequatur. Velit repellat necessitatibus quas quia aspernatur dignissimos omnis atque. Ut aspernatur et enim natus eos illum assumenda quaerat magnam. At et minus natus. Aut qui et maiores ullam culpa.

example.title: Pre
example.code: Quae assumenda hic est facilis. Sed voluptatem molestiae vel ipsum accusantium earum asperiores. Ea sunt quo. Temporibus vero modi molestiae vel provident eius repellat.

example.title: Pre-line
example.code: Quod quia nam earum beatae et facere voluptatum sed fuga. Voluptate earum consectetur. Saepe minus maxime et et explicabo vitae. Quia non officiis consequatur. Nobis eveniet vel voluptatem aspernatur consequatur consequuntur vel doloremque. Et aliquid vel quis sint.

example.title: Pre-wrap
example.code: At repellat non deserunt. Aliquid voluptates assumenda id odit dolor quae. Eveniet aut eveniet doloribus similique tempore explicabo aliquam. Et ullam ab accusamus omnis accusantium. Laudantium odio praesentium voluptatum ut dolore eum.

example.title: Revert
example.code: In debitis debitis excepturi corrupti tempora dolorem. Sed animi quo facere officia hic consequatur et quidem quae. A consequatur cum modi velit recusandae.

example.title: Unset
example.code: Quasi esse dolore libero maxime incidunt in minus mollitia. Modi aut qui vitae praesentium voluptas. Blanditiis ab blanditiis totam modi commodi.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Icons
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.
